result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brequan Daeshawn Smith

records.addlTxt: Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent is in trial on another matter; defendant not produced. Case scheduled for a plea/sentencing hearing for January 12, 2023 at 11:00 am; IN PERSON; both parties agreed to date and time, via email.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment ( 21 pages) commencing 07-22-2022 by Denise J. Pahman.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Brequan Daeshawn Smith not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they are in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea Hearing to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 17.

Defendant Brequan Daeshawn Smith in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Police Oficer Josue Ayala  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge  Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge  Grayson, Br. 16.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.
  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brequan Daeshawn Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brequan Daeshawn Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Brequan Daeshawn Smith in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brequan Daeshawn Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
